label: 非時
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Monks were supposed to confine their eating to the morning hours.  Food eaten after noon was called untimely" or "out-of-hours" (hiji) (p. 772n). "
